page.title: 02NETTLETON,LOCAL INDUSTRY
page.content: Kingfisher Windows,Nettleton,Lincs. employs 11 local people.They also have 40 salesmen around the country.They make aluminium windows and have a factory in Consett which makes P.V.C windows.The company started in Grimsby 7 yrs.ago but moved to Caistor where the managers lived and then bought the Nettleton site.In 1983 they opened the Consett factory for selling to Scotland.The windows are assembled in the factories,delivered to warehouses all over the country and then installed by local fixing gangs. Transport from Nettleton to the rest of the country is easy via the M18, M180,M62,M1 and A1.Most orders are local or off the A1 but as time progresses more orders are coming from further afield.
